overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach to time-series forecasting focused on handling hourly data with daily seasonality. The analyst identifies key patterns, evaluates multiple simple methods under computational constraints, and implements a practical solution using averaged daily cycles. The approach prioritizes interpretability and simplicity while addressing data limitations like short history and potential outliers.
common_data_patterns: Day-of-week effects (observed pattern differences between weekdays/weekends)
Complete data (no missing values in input)
key_insights: Prioritization of simplicity when constrained by limited data (only 4 days of history)
Explicit handling of outlier days through averaging to mitigate their impact
Hourly pattern replication as a solution for multi-day forecasting
Consideration of day-of-week effects despite insufficient data for modeling
Data rounding and formatting consistency for output generation
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with practical simplifications. Features detailed pattern analysis and method evaluation, but ultimately implements straightforward averaging due to data limitations and computational constraints.
